attributes.action: Establish a safe and legal route for Ukrainian refugees to enter the UK
attributes.additional_details:
The Home Office is no longer accepting visa applications from Ukrainians stuck in Ukraine (Independent). This is a heartless decision and the Government must immediately rescind this policy so that Ukrainians can have a fair shot at acquiring a UK visa. 

Further, Ukrainians are being displaced en masse by war and, as such, are refugees. A special track to enter the UK must be established for Ukrainian citizens to show our solidarity and support and to help families seek safety during the war.
attributes.background: The Home Office must immediately rescind its decision not to accept visa applications from Ukrainians stuck in Ukraine. A special route (which is safe and legal) for UK visas and/or refugee status should be established to assist Ukrainians in relocating to the UK, should they choose to do so.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Offer fast track asylum to any Ukrainians displaced due to the invasion: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609382

Waive visa requirement for Ukrainian refugees: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609530

Help Ukrainian refugees and create a safe path for them to get to the UK: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609574

Draw up and implement a specific Ukrainian refugee strategy for the UK: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609431

Grant Ukrainian citizens fleeing the war full rights to live and work in the UK: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609434
